meanings.definition: To circulate or be circulated again.
meanings.sent1: The water in the fountain was recirculating continuously.
meanings.sent2: After cleaning the filter, the pool pump recirculated the water.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the party kept recirculating among the students.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were recirculating in his mind like a never-ending loop.
meanings.sent5: The recirculating fan spread the cool air throughout the room.

meanings.sent1: She recirculated the air in the room by opening the windows.
meanings.sent2: The teacher recirculated the assignment for those who missed it.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally recirculated the same joke during dinner service.
meanings.sent4: His speech successfully recirculated enthusiasm among the audience.
meanings.sent5: The recirculating pump helped distribute heat evenly in the house.

meanings.sent1: The recirculating water feature added a calming ambiance to the garden.
meanings.sent2: The recirculating news articles kept appearing on social media.
meanings.sent3: The recirculating joke at the party never failed to make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her recirculating thoughts about the upcoming exam made her anxious.
meanings.sent5: The recirculating system ensured efficient use of resources in the factory.
